fever.advice: Rest, stay hydrated with plenty of fluids, monitor temperature regularly. Take acetaminophen or ibuprofen as directed. Seek medical care if fever exceeds 103°F (39.4°C) or persists for more than 3 days.
red_flags: Fever with severe headache and stiff neck
Difficulty breathing or shortness of breath
fever.when_to_see_doctor: If fever persists beyond 3 days or exceeds 103°F

headache.advice: Rest in a quiet, dark room. Stay hydrated. Apply cold or warm compress. Consider over-the-counter pain relievers like acetaminophen or ibuprofen. Practice relaxation techniques.
red_flags: Sudden, severe headache (worst headache of your life)
Headache with fever, stiff neck, and rash
Headache with vision changes or loss
headache.duration: Tension headaches: hours to days; Migraines: 4-72 hours
headache.when_to_see_doctor: Sudden severe headache, recurring pattern changes, or with neurological symptoms

cough.advice: Stay hydrated, use a humidifier, avoid irritants like smoke. Honey can help soothe throat. Elevate head while sleeping. Avoid cough suppressants for productive coughs.
red_flags: Coughing up blood or pink-tinged sputum
cough.duration: Acute: 2-3 weeks; Chronic: more than 8 weeks
cough.when_to_see_doctor: Cough with blood, severe breathing difficulty, or persistent beyond 3 weeks

stomach pain.advice: Eat bland foods, stay hydrated, avoid dairy and spicy foods. Consider over-the-counter antacids. Rest and avoid strenuous activity. Apply gentle heat to abdomen for comfort.
red_flags: Blood in stool or black stool
stomach pain.duration: Acute: hours to days; Chronic: weeks to months
stomach pain.when_to_see_doctor: Severe pain, signs of infection, or symptoms of dehydration
